member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Arguments.Argument
member.summary: Abstract command line argument that can have name, description, aliases and can be marked optional/mandatory.

remarks.p: Argument class is a base class for all the argument types.

To use the argument parser, you can either create your own argument types by deriving from Argument class or you can use some of the argument types provided out of the box that cover the usual user scenarios.

member.summary: Parse argument. This method should read the input arguments and set the argument fields.
member.param: index to the args array, where this argument occured. Parse method should move the index to the next argument after the argument is processed.
member.remarks: It is up to the argument class how many words it will consume from the command line. At the end, it should just point the index to the correct place where the argument class passes the control back to the

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser
member.summary: CommandLineParser allows user to define command line arguments and then parse the arguments from the command line.

remarks.p: CommandLineParser is the fundamental class of the whole library. It main purpose is to find the defined arguments on the command line and for each such argument call the Parse method that reads the value of the argument.

CommandLineParser keeps the argument definitions in its Arguments collection. This collection can be filled explicitly by creating proper objects and adding them to the collection. The other way is declaring argument attributes in some of your classes and then letting the CommandLineParser extract the argument from instances of these classes and bind the class' instances fields to the extracted arguments (this is done in .
For an example of using argument attributes, see .
This is an example of using the CommandLineParser

ul.li: creating an instance of the parser
adding the arguments to the parser
calling method to process the arguments

member.name: M:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.InitializeArgumentLookupDictionaries
member.summary: Fills lookup dictionaries with arguments names and aliases

member.name: M:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ParseCommandLine(System.String[])
member.summary: Resolves arguments from the command line and calls on each argument. Additional arguments are stored in AdditionalArgumentsSettings.AdditionalArguments if AdditionalArgumentsSettings.AcceptAdditionalArguments is set to true.
member.exception: Command line arguments are not in correct format

member.name: M:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ExtractArgumentAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Searches for fields with ArgumentAttributes or some of its descendats. Adds new argument for each such a field and defines binding of the argument to the field. Also adds object to collection for each of .
member.param: object where you with some ArgumentAttributes

member.name: M:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ParseArgument(System.String)
member.summary: Parses one argument on the command line, lookups argument in using lookup dictionaries.
member.exception: Command line is in the wrong format
Unknown argument found.

members.member:
Checks whether or non-optional arguments were defined on the command line.
Non-optional argument not defined. ,

Arguments that are not switches found in a group.

member.summary: Prints arguments information and usage information to the console.

member.name: M:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ShowParsedArguments
member.summary: Prints values of parsed arguments. Can be used for debugging.

summary.para: Fills FullDescription of all the difined arguments from a resource file. For each argument selects a string from a resource that has the same resource key as is the currrent value of the argument's FullDescription.
This way the value of FullDescription's can be set to keys and these keys are replaced by the resource values when the method is called.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.Arguments
member.summary: Defined command line arguments

member.summary: Set of certifications - certifications can be used to define which argument combinations are allowed and such type of validations.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ShowUsageHeader

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ShowUsageFooter
member.summary: Text printed in the end of 'show usage'

member.summary: Arguments that directly invoke . By default this is --help and /?.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.ShowUsageOnEmptyCommandline
member.summary: When set to true, usage help is printed on the console when command line is without arguments. Default is false.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.CheckMandatoryArguments
member.summary: When set to true, is thrown when some of the non-optional argument is not found on the command line. Default is true. See:

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.CheckArgumentCertifications
member.summary: When set to true, arguments are certified (using set of ) after parsing. Default is true.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.AllowShortSwitchGrouping
member.summary: When set to true (default) switch arguments can be grouped on the command line. (e.g. -a -b -c can be written as -abc). When set to false and such a group is found, is thrown.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.AcceptSlash
member.summary: Allows arguments in /a and /arg format

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.AcceptHyphen
member.summary: Allows arguments in -a and --arg format

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Argument names case insensitive (--OUTPUT or --output are treated equally)

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser.AcceptEqualSignSyntaxForValueArguments
member.summary: When set to true, values of are separeted by space, otherwise, they are separeted by equal sign and enclosed in quotation marks

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Validation.DistinctGroupsCertification
member.summary: Allows to define which two groups of arguments that can not be used together.

remarks.p: You can use certifications to define which arguments combinations are allowed and forbidden in your application. Use and for this purpose.
You can also create your own certification classes to test other conditions.

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Validation.ArgumentCertification
member.summary: Certification object can be used to define more complex conditions for arguments. Certifications are checked after command line is parsed and the Certify method is supposed to throw an exception when the arguments and their values do not meet the do condition.

remarks.p: You can use certifications to define which arguments combinations are allowed and forbidden in your application. Use and for this purpose.
You can also create your own certification classes to test other conditions.

member.name: M:CommandLineParser.Validation.ArgumentCertification.Certify(CommandLineParser.CommandLineParser)
member.summary: Test the parser for the certification. This method should throw an exception if the condition is not met.
member.param: parser object gives access to the defined arguments, their values and parameters of the parser

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Arguments.FileArgumentAttribute

summary.para: Attribute for declaring a class' field a and thus binding a field's value to a certain command line switch argument.
Instead of creating an argument explicitly, you can assign a class' field an argument attribute and let the CommandLineParse take care of binding the attribute to the field.

member.remarks: Appliable to fields and properties (public).
Use for each object you where you have delcared argument attributes.

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Arguments.ArgumentAttribute

summary.para: Base class for argument attributes. Each subclass of Argument has corresponding subclass of ArgumentAttribute that can be used to define the Argument declaratively.
Instead of creating an argument explicitly, you can assign a class' field an argument attribute and let the CommandLineParse take care of binding the attribute to the field.

member.remarks: Use for each object you where you have delcared argument attributes.

member.summary: Creates new instance of ArgumentAttribute.
member.param: Parameters of the constructor of underlying argument

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Arguments.ArgumentAttribute.LongName
member.summary: Long name of the argument. Can apear on the command line in --longName format. Must be one word.
member.exception: Name is invalid

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Arguments.ArgumentAttribute.Optional
member.summary:
Mark argument optional. Arguments with Optional = false can be checked in method.
Default is true

member.summary: Allows argument to appear multiple times on the command line. Default is false.

member.exception: Name is invalid

ield of that will be bound to the argument

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.IResource
member.summary: Interface for resources. Give your resource classes this interface so that they can be used for call. That way you can assign the property of your arguments defined using declarative syntax to strings in resource class. In argument declarations, use the resource key as a value of FullDescription property and then call after the parser is initialized. It will replace the key with the string from resource in the arguments. See help file for an example

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.IResource.ResourceManager
member.summary: Gets the resource manager.

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Arguments.SwitchArgument
member.summary: Switch argument can be used to represent options with true/false logic. It is initialized with default value and when the argument appears on the command line, the value is flipped.

member.name: T:CommandLineParser.Arguments.SwitchArgumentAttribute

summary.para: Attribute for declaring a class' field a and thus binding a field's value to a certain command line switch argument.
Instead of creating an argument explicitly, you can assign a class' field an argument attribute and let the CommandLineParse take care of binding the attribute to the field.

member.remarks: Applicable to fields and properties (public).
Use for each object you where you have declared argument attributes.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.CERT_REMARKS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument combinations remarks:.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ADDITIONAL_ARGS_TOO_EARLY
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to AdditionalArguments cannot be accessed before ParseCommandLine is called..

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ADDITIONAL_ARGUMENTS_FOUND
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Additional arguments found and parser does not accept additional arguments. Set AcceptAdditionalArguments to true if you want to accept them. .

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ADDITONAL_ARGS_FORBIDDEN
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to AcceptAdditionalArguments is set to false therefore AdditionalArguments can not be read..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument value {0} is greater then maximum value {1}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument value {0} is lesser then minimum value {1}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Value {0} is not allowed for argument {1}.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_NOT_ONE_CHAR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to ShortName of an argument must not be whitespace character..

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_NOT_ONE_WORD
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to LongName of an argument must be one word..

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_SWITCH_PRINT
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument: {0} value: {1}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unknown argument found: {0}..

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_VALUE_MISSING
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Value argument {0} must be followed by a value, another argument ({1}) found instead.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Value argument {0} must be followed by a value..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument {0} can not be used multiple times..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument: {0}, type: {3}, value: {2} (converted from: {1}).

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_VALUE_PRINT_MULTIPLE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument: {0}, type: {3}, occured {1}x values: {2}.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_VALUE_STANDARD_CONVERT_FAILED
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to convert string {0} to type {1} using standard {1}.ParseCommandLine. Use strings in accepted format or define custom conversion using ConvertValueHandler..

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_VALUE_STRINGVALUE_ACCESS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Arguments StringValue can be read after ParseCommandLine is called..

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_ARG_VALUE_USER_CONVERT_MISSING
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Type {0} of argument {1} is not a built-in type. Set ConvertValueHandler to a conversion routine for this type or define static method Parse(string stringValue, CultureInfo cultureInfo) that can Parse your type from string. .

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Messages.EXC_BAD_ARG_IN_GROUP
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Grouping of multiple short name arguments in one word (e.g. -a -b into -ab) is allowed only for switch arguments. Argument {0} is not a switch argument..

member.remarks: Parameter has to be either built-in type or has to define a static Parse(String, CultureInfo) method for reading the value from string.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Arguments.EnumeratedValueArgumentAttribute.AllowedValues
member.summary: Allowed values of the argument, separated by commas or semicolons.

member.name: P:CommandLineParser.Arguments.EnumeratedValueArgumentAttribute.DefaultValue
member.summary: Default value
